Package com.github.actionfx.core.instrumentation

Class ControllerWrapper<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.actionfx.core.instrumentation.ControllerWrapper<T>
  • public class ControllerWrapper<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    Wrapper class around a JavaFX controller that is enhanced either with an instrumentation agent or via sub-classing. The wrapper offers convenient methods to access e.g. the view field that is added by byte-code enhancement.
    Author:
    koster

        Convenient factory method for a ControllerWrapper.
        Parameters:
        controller - the controller wrapper
        Returns:
        the wrapper instance

      • setView

        public void setView​(View view)
        Sets the given View into the wrapped controller.
        Parameters:
        view - the view to set

      • getView

        public View getView()
        Gets the View from the wrapped controller.
        Returns:
        the view

      • getScene

        public javafx.scene.Scene getScene()
        Gets the Scene that the controller's view is part of. In case the view has not yet been added to a scene, null is returned.
        Returns:
        the Scene that the wrapped node is part of, or null, in case the controller's view has not been added to a scene.

      • getWindow

        public javafx.stage.Window getWindow()
        Gets the Window where the controller's view is currently displayed in. In case the view has not yet been displayed, null is returned.
        Returns:
        the Window in that this view is displayed, or null, in case the node has not yet been displayed.

      • setViewOn

        public static void setViewOn​(java.lang.Object controller,
                             View view)
        Convenient static method for setting the given View to the supplied controller.
        Parameters:
        controller - the controller to set the view into
        view - the view to set

      • getViewFrom

        public static View getViewFrom​(java.lang.Object controller)
        Convenient static method for getting the View from the supplied controller.
        Parameters:
        controller - the controller to get the view from
        Returns:
        the retrieved View

      • getViewField

        public java.lang.reflect.Field getViewField()
        Retrieves the field that is expected to hold the View. In case the class does not hold the expected field or the field is of an unexpected type, an IllegalStateException is thrown.
        Returns:
        the field that is holding the view
